content.question: In a certain town, the population in the year 2000 was about <math alttext="30 , 000"><semantics><mn>30,000</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The population grows at a rate of <math alttext="2.3 percent sign"><semantics><mrow><mn>2.3</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> per year, and time is measured in years since 2000. Which of the following functions gives output values, in years since 2000, for input values of the town’s population <math alttext="p"><semantics><mi>p</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="f open parentheses p close parentheses equals 30 , 000 times open parentheses 1.023 close parentheses to the power of p"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>p</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>30,000</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mfenced><mn>1.023</mn></mfenced><mi>p</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses p close parentheses equals log subscript 1.023 end subscript open parentheses fraction numerator p over denominator 30 , 000 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>p</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>1.023</mn></msub><mfenced><mfrac><mi>p</mi><mn>30,000</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="h open parentheses p close parentheses equals fraction numerator p minus 30 , 000 over denominator 2.3 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>p</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>30,000</mn></mrow><mn>2.3</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="k open parentheses p close parentheses equals 30 , 000 times log subscript 1.023 end subscript p"><semantics><mrow><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>p</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>30,000</mn><mo>·</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>1.023</mn></msub><mi>p</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="g open parentheses p close parentheses equals log subscript 1.023 end subscript open parentheses fraction numerator p over denominator 30 , 000 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>p</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>1.023</mn></msub><mfenced><mfrac><mi>p</mi><mn>30,000</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.14: Logarithmic Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
